summary:
King Arthur is a legendary British king and a popular figure in medieval stories. According to Welsh legends, he led the Britons against the Anglo-Saxons in the 5th and 6th centuries. While some historical sources mention him, many historians believe he might not be a real historical figure.

Arthur's story became famous through Geoffrey of Monmouth's book, which described his battles, magical sword (Excalibur), and adventures with characters like Merlin and Guinevere. Later, French writers added more tales, introducing Lancelot and the Holy Grail. Arthurian legends have been told in many ways over the centuries and are still popular today in books, movies, and other media.
title: King Arthur
